record.description: West of the Nile beneath an Egyptian plateau is a cemetery, where Arab communities have buried their dead in domed tombs. Aerial photograph taken from the plane of Dr. James H. Breasted, director of the Oriental Institute.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: Second caption reiterates that first: Dr. Breasted's plane flies over a great modern Arab [word missing] containing thousands of domed tombs in the [word missing] desert between the desert plateau and the cultivation bordering the Nile." Captions attached, photographer/credit line stamp and Chicago Daily News stamp w/date.
